title: Đorđe Kunovac
text:
Đorđe Kunovac (<a href="Serbian%20Cyrillic">Serbian Cyrillic</a>: Ђорђе Куновац, born 8 June 1975) is a retired professional Bosnian-Herzegovinian <a href="association%20football">football</a> player and a current football manager.
Playing career.
Club.
Born in <a href="Trebinje">Trebinje</a>, he began playing football in his home-town club <a href="FK%20Leotar">FK Leotar</a>. He was spotted there by <a href="FK%20Partizan">FK Partizan</a> who brought him to their youth team. He started playing as senior in the <a href="First%20League%20of%20FR%20Yugoslavia">First League of FR Yugoslavia</a> clubs <a href="FK%20Be%C4%8Dej">FK Bečej</a> and <a href="FK%20Rad">FK Rad</a>. He played with Leotar in the <a href="First%20League%20of%20the%20Republika%20Srpska">First League of the Republika Srpska</a> during until 2000, before coming to <a href="Germany">Germany</a> to play in <a href="Fortuna%20D%C3%BCsseldorf">Fortuna Düsseldorf</a>. Afterwards, he was back to Rad and in 2002 played for <a href="Montenegro">Montenegrin</a> club <a href="FK%20Mogren">FK Mogren</a> before finishing his playing career in <a href="FK%20Sin%C4%91eli%C4%87%20Beograd">FK Sinđelić Beograd</a>.
Coach.
He was the coach of a <a href="Belgrade">Belgrade</a>-based <a href="Serbia">Serbian</a> club FK Sveti Stefan. For the 2011-12 season he was appointed as head coach of FK Milutinac Zemun. After a few months Kunovac resigned as coach of FK Milutinac Zemun and later that year he was appointed as manager of <a href="FK%20Palilulac%20Beograd">FK Palilulac Beograd</a>. For the 2012-2013 season he started as a head coach of a FK Zmaj Zemun, but again after a few months re-resigned. Second part of the 2012/2013 season he worked again as a head coach in FK Milutinac Zemun, and played for the Senior team. For the 2013/2014 season he was appointed as a manager of <a href="Slovakia">Slovak</a> side <a href="FK%20Spartak%20B%C3%A1novce%20nad%20Bebravou">FK Spartak Bánovce nad Bebravou</a>. 
At the beginning of the 2014/2015 season he took over managing Belgrade lower league club FK Torlak from Kumodraž. FK Torlak competes in 5th tier of Serbian football league system. In his first season as FK Torlak manager he won the league and got promoted to Beogradska Zona (4th tier). He won the first tournament named Trofej Voždovac. In his second season the team won second Trofej Voždovac, and later that year fourth place on the end of the first part of the season, surprising everyone, which was expected by no one. FK Torlak style of play was recognizable in Belgrade at the time. Sadly, he resigned 3 rounds before end of the season due to differences with the club management. He was considered one of the best coaches in the league. After that he led newly-promoted FK Avala in their debut season 2016/2017 in Beogradska Zona. He got relegated due to poor quality in squad, and uninterested club management. He resigned at the end of the season. In the 2017/2018 season he took the helm of FK Sremčica and a club from Beogradska Zona. He completely rebuilt the squad prior to the season resulting poor displays in the first seven rounds. After that, everything got better and FK Sremčica won 4 matches plus 4 matches ended in a draw, which led to 10th place after the first part of the season.
